Red dragons are second-to-most powerful of the adult chromatic dragons. As with all adult dragons, an anti-dragon shield and/or antifire potion is essential when fighting them to mitigate damage from their dragonfire. The red dragonhides and dragon bones that they drop are worth substantial amounts of money.

The ability to be assigned red dragons can be purchased for 50 Slayer reward points. Once unlocked, they can be disabled, but players must spend another 50 points to unlock them again. Killing brutal red dragons in the Catacombs of Kourend will also count toward a red dragon task. One Red Dragon is fought during Dragon Slayer II.

After completing the Karamja Elite Diary, red dragons in Brimhaven Dungeon will drop noted red dragonhides when killed.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The average Red dragon kill is worth 7,637.95.

The average Red dragon kill while on a Konar task is worth 8,911.93.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Dragon bones1Always2,85896
Red dragonhide1Always[1]2,33087

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 March 2015
(update | poll)

Red dragons in the Brimhaven Dungeon now drop noted hides if you have completed the Karamja Elite Diary.

29 March 2004 –
29 August 2006 		29 August 2006 –
present

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Red dragons formerly inhabited the Red Dragon Isle (now Lava Dragon Isle) in the Wilderness, but they were replaced with Lava dragons in the Wilderness Rejuvenation update (in canon, this transformation was due to the fact that they had been living surrounded by lava for a very long time).
  • Red dragons are the rarest type of chromatic dragon.
